poem:
Title: "An Orchard of Ideas censored"

In Florida's classrooms,
books fall as pulp
under the press of
Discontented authority.
Teachers, scapegoats,
harboring forbidden texts -
each a ripened fruit
stripped from the idea tree.
As the newsprint sings – 
a chorus of silenced voices,
principals now sit in line
for the blame-game feast.
Free thought snagged -
caught in the governor's net,
under his red-blossomed gaze.
